snippet: The pursuit of short-term profit led banks to become too aggressive and disconnected from wider society, the chief executive of Barclays, Antony P. Jenkins, wrote in an op-ed article in The Sunday Telegraph.
abstract: The pursuit of short-term profit led banks to become too aggressive and disconnected from wider society, the chief executive of Barclays, Antony P. Jenkins, wrote in an op-ed article in The Sunday Telegraph.
